intro: Thesium linophyllon var. montanum, commonly known as the mountain thesium, is a low-growing perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions. Thesium linophyllon var. montanum is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of alpine flora.
